title: You know you're a typophile if...
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081007002825im_/http:/farm1.static.flickr.com/111/363004678_ffeece9096.jpg?v=0)  
  
You know you're a typophile if you look at this and see an O emerging from a horizon.  
  
If you look at this and see a red canopy/umbrella, then perhaps not.

[Enlarge it on Flickr](http://web.archive.org/web/20081007002825/http:/www.flickr.com/photos/joepemberton/363004678/)

 [‹ bodoni new cut](http://web.archive.org/web/20081007002825/http:/www.typophile.com/node/31076 "Go to previous forum topic") [Gotham Rounded: All the Rage? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081007002825/http:/www.typophile.com/node/30508 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Joe Pemberton

comments.content: It looks more like a 0 to me, sorry to be picky but…
I see a tongue, and a sailboat crossing the Red Sea.

DO YOU SEE ALL THE I’S HERE?

[http://www.awning-tent.com/redesign/images/logo.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20081007002825/http:/www.awning-tent.com/redesign/images/logo.gif "http://www.awning-tent.com/redesign/images/logo.gif")
I guess I’m not a Typophile :-(

i can see OM there.  
but am more interested in the person who’s pant is falling ;)
Actually, I saw a Cyrillic capital D.
I see a D on lying on its back.

\> I guess I’m not a Typophile :-(

Dan, you qualify thanks to this unobtrusive capital C around your face...

I hope so, Sebastian… I hope so ;-)

I read signs out loud as I walk past them while walking down the street. The letters just jump out at me. Sometimes I think that other people might hear me and think I’m crazy, so I stop for a few minutes.

I thought that sign was an O for the longest time until I stopped to examine it closer. It still has no meaning to me since there’s no signage around it to give any clues (except for the building’s address in the gold underneath).

Cyrillic D... makes you a Cyrillophile.

Well... I saw an A, I’m sure that counts.

Héctor

Sabre tooth Tiger with severe overbight? :-)

ChrisL

Well, I hate to admit this, but stepping over my doorjamb is a major undertaking, because I have to READ en CLASSIFY anything that’s visible/readable. And that’s NOT part of any glyph. Discussion closed, right?

I thought it was an ’Ω’ but maybe that’s because I’ve got my Greek textbook open at the moment.

- Lex

Eye of Saromon.

Happy birthday ChrisL
